entry.title: Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (23)
entry.content:
Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (23)20140521
I did two series tonight in about an hour. I didn't have to do any
races twice, although each one had their own moments of
anxiety. The cars felt pretty slippery. I used the Elise on the
British Lightweights and the Corvette on the Night Races.

International B - 42% - 45 - 331 - 35 - 203 - 113 - $3.338mil

Total time: 32:43

I did the Dirt Races in an hour and a half today. My hands hurt
from so much wheel motion. It required very aggressive driving to
win. It was pretty fun, but a bit stressful.

entry.title: Game: Mario & Luigi: Dream Team (3DS, 2013) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Mario & Luigi: Dream Team (3DS, 2013) (4)20140519
I played this for about thirty minutes and finished a dungeon. I'm
really underwhelmed by this game. It is clean and seems fine, but
not special at all and I don't think I'm going to spend my time on
it. Since it came as a bundle with my 3DS, I don't feel like I
bought it, so I feel okay about that.

Total time: 3:51
  • Video Games
  • Mario & Luigi: Dream Team
  • 3DS
  • 2013

entry.content:
Game: The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Anniversary Edition (DS, 2011)20140519
I played the tutorial level in about 30 minutes. The game is very

done and haven't done on the select screen, but I'm sure I'll get
over it.

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 19 - New Moon Rising
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 19 - New Moon Rising20140519
I really like this episode. It's a classic Buffy moment when the
theme is "forbidden love" but that is mixed up with humans &
demons as well as girls & girls. Oz plays it pretty cool and is a
nice reason for Willow to come out.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 18A - Five by Five
entry.content:
Buffy & Angel - Season 4 - Episode 18A - Five by Five20140519
Faith is one of my favorite characters and I love how much Angel
cares about her. Wesley is such a punk to her back in Buffy and
this episode reminds me of it as he goes after her with a
knife. It's so sad that Angel can't take care of her as much as
he wants to and she needs. It's also nice that Wolfram & Hart are
finally players in the show.
  • TV Shows
  • Buffy & Angel

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 7 - Mockingbird
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 4 - Episode 7 - Mockingbird20140519
Arya! So amazing! Dany too! I wonder who Tyrion will have fight
for him. Ah! I remember that the Prince of Dorn wants the
Mountain dead. Petyr! I KNEW he would do that when he showed up.
  • TV Shows

entry.title: Movie: Back to School, starring Rodney Dangerfield (1986)
entry.content:
Movie: Back to School, starring Rodney Dangerfield (1986)20140518
This is such a dumb movie, but it has a lot of nostalgia for me
because it was on Comedy Central so much when I was young. One of
the absurder things that I didn't remember was that Lou continues
to hang out with the girl he meets in the bar. It's also funny that
Robert Downey, Jr's teeth are so bad. It's crazy that Kurt Vonnegut
is in it. The movie is basically just a bunch of one-liners though.
  • Movies
  • 1986

entry.title: Book: The Gods of Mars, by Edgar Rice Burroughs (1918) (2)
entry.content:
Book: The Gods of Mars, by Edgar Rice Burroughs (1918) (2)20140517
I finished this today. It turned out to be really exciting and had
a lot of "world building". The idea of the evil gods was very
clever with the multiple layers. I can't believe it ended on such a
cliff-hanger though.

entry.title: Book: William Shakespeare's Star Wars, by Ian Doescher (2013)
entry.content:
Book: William Shakespeare's Star Wars, by Ian Doescher (2013)20140514
I read this today on a flight. I was very impressed by how
consistently funny and well it worked in classic moments from
Shakespeare plays.

Here's a nice line from the beginning:

LUKE---
First droids, then tales of
battles fought in space,
And now a damsel cries
in beams of light!
Did ever destiny come
knocking thus?
...
Whoever she may be,
whatever is
Her cause, I shall unto her
pleas respond.
Not e'en were she my
sister could I know
A duty of more weight
than I feel now

I kind of wish I could immediately move on to the next books. I
also think it would pretty amazing to see it performed.
  • Books
  • 2013

entry.title: Book: The Dragons of Eden: Speculations on the Evolution of Human Intelligence, by Carl Sagan (1977)
entry.content:
Book: The Dragons of Eden: Speculations on the Evolution of Human Intelligence, by Carl Sagan (1977)20140514
I read this book today and found it very entertaining. I love this
medium-weight science reads. I think the two most interesting parts
of the book for me were how excited Sagan was about computer games
and all the parts about teaching apes sign language.

The exciting thing about the game discussion was how he clearly
says that games are great because they teach an intuitive
understanding of complex systems, like physics. I feel this way
very strongly about games like Mario. In this same section, he
relates the idea that writing makes us forget rather than
remember. Here's the quote from Plato's Phaedrus he uses:

"But when they came to letters, This, said Thoth, will make the
Egyptians wiser and give them better memories; it is a specific
both for the memory and for the wit. Thamus replied: O most
ingenious Thoth, the parent or inventor of an art is not always the
best judge of the utility or inutility of his own inventions to the
users of them. And in this instance, you who are the father of
letters, from a paternal love of your own children have been led to
attribute to them a quality which they cannot have; for this
discovery of yours will create forgetfulness in the learners'
souls, because they will not use their memories; they will trust to
the external written characters and not remember of themselves. The
specific which you have discovered is an aid not to memory, but to
reminiscence, and you give your disciples not truth, but only the
semblance of truth; they will be hearers of many things and will
have learned nothing; they will appear to be omniscient and will
generally know nothing; they will be tiresome company, having the
show of wisdom without the reality."

But I was really blown away by the discussion of the primates and
their understanding of language and logic. I think I cried when I
read what one chimpanzee wrote to her machine: "Please, machine,
tickle Lana." It's so beautiful. It makes me want to get involved
in teaching them language and advancing their species. I seriously
cried in the middle of the airport waiting for a flight when I read
that.
  • Books
  • 1977
